greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Start with the normalized multiset of prime factors of n > 1. Given a multiset, take the multiset of its multiplicities. Repeat this until a multiset of size 1 is obtained. a(n) is the unique element of this multiset.
formula: a(p^n) = n where p is any prime number and n > 1.
a(product of n > 1 distinct primes) = n.
example: Starting with the normalized multiset of prime factors of 360, we obtain {1,1,1,2,2,3} -> {1,2,3} -> {1,1,1} -> {3}, so a(360) = 3.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, May 13 2018
